subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Rearrangement and Replication Error Aging Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS production by mitochondria causing oxidative damage and a vicious cycle of mtDNA mutations and ROS leading to aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS as aging drivers, oxidative stress, and energy metabolism decline linked to aging.
Highlights mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative damage, and mitophagy decline contributing to aging.
Describes mitochondrial ROS accumulation causing oxidative damage and structural mitochondrial changes during seed aging.
Focuses on mtDNA mutations increasing ROS, oxidative damage, antioxidant defense decline, and mitohormesis in aging.
Details mitochondrial ROS causing oxidative damage and cardiovascular aging via a vicious cycle of mitochondrial damage.
Proposes endogenous mitochondrial ROS cause cumulative damage and aging, balanced by antioxidant and repair mechanisms.
Links mitochondrial ROS production and oxidative damage to aging rate and sex differences in longevity.
Describes mitochondrial ROS causing oxidative damage, OXPHOS decline, and a vicious cycle of mtDNA damage driving aging.
Focuses on mtDNA mutations causing respiration defects and ROS overproduction contributing to aging.
Emphasizes mtDNA mutations and mitochondrial ROS causing oxidative damage and aging, supported by mitochondrially targeted interventions.
Discusses mitochondrial ROS as damaging agents and signaling molecules, with ROS production rate correlating inversely with lifespan.
Details mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative damage accumulation, and mitochondrial dysfunction in aging heart and muscles.
Describes mitochondrial ROS and oxidative damage, mtDNA mutation accumulation, bioenergetic decline, and mitohormesis in aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS causing oxidative damage, antioxidant defense modulation, and mitochondrial dysfunction in aging diseases.
Highlights oxidative damage accumulation, ATP production decline, mtDNA mutations, and apoptosis linked to mitochondrial ROS.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS-induced mtDNA damage, ETC impairment, and a vicious cycle of ROS and mtDNA damage driving aging.
Describes mitochondrial ROS generation, mtDNA mutation accumulation, tissue-specific vulnerability, and systemic aging effects.
Focuses on mitochondria as ROS sources, mtDNA mutation accumulation, free radical-induced cell death, and oxidative damage markers.
Links mitochondrial ROS accumulation, mtDNA damage, impaired mitochondrial dynamics, and energy sensing dysregulation to sarcopenia.
Describes mitochondrial ROS production, mtDNA mutation accumulation, and mitochondrial dysfunction leading to neurodegeneration.
Proposes mitochondrial ROS production rate correlates with longevity, oxidative damage to mtDNA/proteins, and caloric restriction effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ETC Complex Dysfunction Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-dependent decline of mitochondrial Complex II activity causing increased ROS and mitochondrial dysfunction driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Rearrangement and Replication Error Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes accumulation of mtDNA rearrangements from replication errors causing bioenergetic decline and tissue-specific aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Rearrangement and Replication Error Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on somatic mtDNA mutations from replication errors causing stem cell dysfunction and tissue-specific aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitonuclear Balance and Respiratory Chain Coordination Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes that coordination between nuclear and mitochondrial gene expression of respiratory chain components regulates mitochondrial function and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Neuroinflammation Feedback Loop Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes bidirectional feedback between mitochondrial dysfunction and microglial activation causing neuroinflammation and neurodegeneration in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Inflammaging Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial decline causing energy metabolism impairment, cellular senescence, inflammaging, and stem cell dysfunction driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Bioenergetics and Topology Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mitochondrial energetic and topological properties govern molecular entropy and bioenergetic decline, driving aging and reflected by VO2 max.
